results.title: Man of marble = Czlowiek z marmuru [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Wajda, Zespol Filmowy 'X' and Film Polski
results.brief_description: Lauded a national hero in the 1950s due to his skills at his trade, Mateusz Birkut has fallen into the shadows. In making a film of the bricklayer’s life, documentary director Krystyna Janda discovers that he used his fame to become involved in politics - resulting in the government wiping out all traces of his accomplishments. Excised by the Polish censors when first released, ‘Man of marble’ uses reconstructions of old black and white newsreels and matches the stylistic tenets of the documentary genre. (Awards: Winner of the FIPRESCI award, Cannes Film Festival, 1978). In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Man of letters (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Professor Dorton Serry, played by Warren Mitchell, is a Man of letters. An esteemed philosopher and lover of all women, he controls his world absolutely. So how does he react when the women in his life step out of their allotted roles and challenge his prejudices and philosophy of life? Adapted from the novel by Glen Tomasetti.

results.title: Man of Flowers
results.brief_description: Norman Kaye won the AFI’s best actor award for this stunning portrayal of Charles Bremer, a strange and sensitive man, whose sensual appreciation of all things beautiful led to his bizarre and erotic relationship with a young bi-sexual named Lisa. “Man of Flowers” is both erotic and richly amusing with a tragic after glow.

results.title: Man of Aran [study extract]
results.creator_credit: Robert Joseph Flaherty, Sir Michael Balcon, GB Film Library and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Extract from the Gaumont British production. The Man of Aran is seen with his two companions…Mikeleen is awakened by the sounds of the rising storm. Mideleen and his mother watch the flimsy craft battling for the shore. The men leap to safety but the sea drags the curragh boat back and smashes it. Man of Aran and his family return homewards.

results.title: Man of Aran
results.creator_credit: Robert Joseph Flaherty and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Robert Flaherty’s story of life on the sea stormed Isles of Aran, off the West Coast of Ireland. Produced in the early days of sound film, Flaherty tells his story simply and with great eloquence. His camera shows the daily events of life on the Isles - a profound and stirring drama of struggle against the elements. This struggle is caught and fixed again and again in images of women and boys against bleak land, vast threatening rocks or cloud-tossed sky, or of the fishermen’s boats lost to sight among heaving mountains of waves. Cinematography by Robert Flaherty.

results.title: Man looks at the moon
results.creator_credit: David MacDougall, Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A study of the geology of the moon as surveyed by the naked eye, Galileo’s telescope, the largest telescopes, photography, spacecraft taking television pictures and finally, man actually on the moon collecting samples. Actual film shot on the moon is used extensively throughout. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Man is to man
results.creator_credit: Stanley Wright, Radio Tunis, Television Suisse and United Nations
results.brief_description: Describes the relief operation carried out jointly by trhe United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and the League of Red Cross Societies on behalf of 200,000 Algerian refugees in Morocco and Tunisia. It is dedicated to all those who through their support made possible this humanitarian action. Commentary by Yul Brynner.
